Package Testing & CRAN Submission Workflow

This document describes the workflow for testing and preparing this package for CRAN submission.

Quick Reference

Option 1: All-in-One Script (Recommended)

source("prepare_for_cran.R")

This script automatically handles all 6 steps: 1. ✅ Verifies package version is updated 2. ✅ Regenerates function documentation from roxygen2 3. ✅ Runs all unit tests with testthat 4. ✅ Verifies NEWS.md is updated 5. ✅ Builds pkgdown documentation site 6. ✅ Runs comprehensive R CMD check for CRAN compliance

Option 2: Quick Development Check

source("quick_check.R")

Runs a faster check during development (skips pkgdown, vignettes).

Option 3: Manual Step-by-Step

# 1. Update version in DESCRIPTION file manually
# Current: 1.1.1

# 2. Document functions
devtools::document()

# 3. Run tests
devtools::test()

# 4. Update NEWS.md manually
# (Already done for v1.1.1)

# 5. Build pkgdown site
pkgdown::build_site()

# 6. Run CRAN checks
devtools::check(args = c("--as-cran"))

Understanding Test Results

testthat (Unit Tests)

  • Located in tests/testthat/
  • test_dimensions.R - Validates data dimensions
  • test_downloads.R - Tests download functions (including graceful failure)

R CMD check

Runs comprehensive CRAN compliance checks: - 0 errors, 0 warnings, 0 notes = Ready for CRAN - Notes are okay if documented (e.g., package size, new maintainer) - Warnings must be fixed - Errors must be fixed

Common devtools Commands

# Install package dependencies
devtools::install_deps()

# Load package for interactive testing
devtools::load_all()

# Run tests
devtools::test()

# Run specific test file
devtools::test_file("tests/testthat/test_downloads.R")

# Check package
devtools::check()

# Build package
devtools::build()

# Build and check
devtools::check_built()

# Submit to CRAN (interactive)
devtools::release()

What Was Changed for CRAN Compliance

The Issue

CRAN policy requires: “Packages which use Internet resources should fail gracefully with an informative message if the resource is not available.”

The Solution (v1.1.1)

  1. Modified R/utils.R:download_data():
    • Wrapped URL downloads in tryCatch
    • Returns NULL on failure instead of throwing error
    • Displays informative message with troubleshooting guidance
  2. Updated documentation:
    • get_data(), get_transactions(), get_promotions()
    • All now document that they return NULL on failure
  3. Added test:
    • tests/testthat/test_downloads.R - Tests graceful failure behavior

Before CRAN Submission

1. Review cran-comments.md

The file has been updated for v1.1.1, but you should verify: - Test environments are current - R CMD check results match your actual results - Changes are accurately described - Any notes are explained

2. Test on Additional Platforms

# Test on Windows (devel and release)
devtools::check_win_devel()
devtools::check_win_release()

# Test on R-hub (multiple platforms)
devtools::check_rhub()

3. Submit to CRAN

# Interactive submission (recommended)
devtools::release()

Or manually via the CRAN submission form.

What’s in cran-comments.md (v1.1.1)

The file documents: - ✅ Graceful failure implementation for internet resources - ✅ Updated documentation - ✅ New unit test for graceful failure - ✅ Vignette typo fix (issue #17) - ✅ Explicitly states compliance with CRAN internet resource policy
